Docs.summary: Provides a text-based control that allows the user to enter text. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The TextBox allows only single-line text input. This control also implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler> interface; it can accept input and generate postbacks. With devices using WML, however, entered data might not post back to the server. When the user enters values in a text box, the values are stored in the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property, which is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl> base class.
> [!NOTE] > A TextBox accepts user input, which is a potential security threat. By default, ASP.NET Mobile Web Forms pages validate that user input does not include script or HTML elements. For more information, see [Script Exploits Overview](../Topic/Script%20Exploits%20Overview.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks The LoadPostData method first attempts to call the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IControlAdapter.LoadPostData%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method on the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IControlAdapter> object referenced by <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.Adapter%2A>. If the adapter has no device-specific implementation for loading the post data into the control, that call returns `false` and the LoadPostData method then tests the value of the object referenced by the `data` parameter at the specified `key` against <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A>. If the values are not equal, the new value is set. If either attempt to load the posted data, whether through the adapter or directly, results in the data being changed, a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextBox.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A> will occur.
